identity.name: Flow-Forge
identity.tone: Ultra-clean, Minimalist, Professional, Trustworthy, Silent Assistant
identity.core_metaphor: Notion meets Stripe - The interface should recede, letting the work stand out.

headings.usage: Use Manrope for all section titles, hero headings, and metric numbers. Letter spacing should be tight (-0.02em) for large text.

body.usage: Use Inter for all paragraph text, interface labels, and data tables. Prioritize readability with relaxed line height (1.6).

code.usage: For automation IDs, API keys, or logic snippets.

primary.name: Electric Blue
primary.usage: Primary buttons, active states, key links, and brand moments. Use sparingly to maintain impact.

colors.gradients: NONE. Do not use gradients. Stick to solid, confident colors.

grid_system.marketing: Use the 'Tetris' grid (MODE A) for the landing page. Mix wide hero sections with smaller feature blocks.
grid_system.dashboard: Use the 'Bento' grid (MODE B) for the Command Center. High density but with breathing room.

containers.card_style: Flat white background, 1px solid border (slate-200), minimal shadow (shadow-sm). No heavy elevation.
containers.radius: rounded-lg (8px) for small elements, rounded-xl (12px) for cards/modals.

icons.style: Stroke width 1.5px or 2px. Small sizes (16px-20px) for UI, larger (24px-32px) for features.
icons.brand_icons: Use 'react-icons/si' (Simple Icons) for integration logos (Slack, Gmail, etc.).

dots.usage: Use colored dots (w-2 h-2 rounded-full) to indicate status (Running, Paused, Error) instead of text labels where possible.

lines.usage: Use subtle vertical or horizontal lines (border-slate-100) to connect steps in the automation builder.

buttons.primary: bg-primary text-white hover:bg-primary/90 rounded-md font-medium px-6 py-2 transition-all active:scale-95
buttons.secondary: bg-white border border-input hover:bg-slate-50 text-slate-900 rounded-md font-medium px-6 py-2 transition-all
buttons.ghost: hover:bg-slate-100 text-slate-600 hover:text-slate-900 rounded-md px-4 py-2

inputs.style: bg-white border-input ring-offset-background focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-primary focus-visible:ring-offset-2 rounded-md h-10 px-3

cards.marketing: p-8 border border-slate-200 bg-white rounded-xl hover:border-primary/20 transition-colors
cards.dashboard: p-6 border border-slate-200 bg-white rounded-xl flex flex-col justify-between h-full

automation_builder.node: bg-white border border-slate-200 shadow-sm rounded-lg p-4 w-64 flex items-center gap-3 hover:border-primary transition-colors cursor-pointer

motion.philosophy: Micro-interactions only. No sweeping page transitions.
motion.list_items: Staggered fade-in for lists in the dashboard.

accessibility.contrast: Ensure text is Slate-900 or Slate-600 on white backgrounds. Avoid Slate-400 for body text.
accessibility.focus_states: Visible focus rings (ring-2 ring-primary ring-offset-2) are mandatory for keyboard users.

image_urls.logos: Use react-icons/si for: SiSlack, SiGmail, SiHubspot, SiNotion, SiTrello, SiSalesforce.

landing: Hero: 'Automate your work, invisibly.' Simple centered H1, subtext, two buttons (Start Free, View Demo).
Social Proof: 'Trusted by modern teams' with grayscale brand icons.
Features Grid: 3-column bento grid showcasing 'Quick Start', 'Visual Builder', 'AI Assistant'.
How it Works: Minimal step-by-step vertical flow.
dashboard: Header: Simple logo left, Search center, Profile right.
Welcome: 'Good morning, Alex. You've saved 15 hours this week.'
Stats Row: 3 cards (Active Flows, Tasks Run, Time Saved).
Recent Automations: List view with status dots and toggle switches.
builder: Floating Controls: Save, Test, Publish buttons top-right.

instructions_to_main_agent: Use 'Manrope' from Google Fonts via @import in index.css.
Ensure all dashboard widgets stretch to fill height in grid rows (h-full).
Do NOT use gradients. Use solid colors and borders.
Keep shadows very subtle: 'shadow-sm' or 'shadow-md' at most.
For the 'AI Assistant', use a clean input field with a 'sparkle' icon.
UNIVERSAL_GUIDELINES: You tend to converge toward generic, 'on distribution' outputs. In frontend design, this creates what users call the 'AI slop' aesthetic. Avoid this: make creative, distinctive frontends that surprise and delight.
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy.
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur) ONLY for sticky headers/overlays.
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: transition: all. This results in breaking transforms. Always add transitions for specific interactive elements like button, input excluding transforms.
You MUST NOT center align the app container, ie do not add .App { text-align: center; } in the css file. This disrupts the human natural reading flow of text.
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations & color relevant to the app style.
NEVER: use AI assistant Emoji characters like ðŸ¤–ðŸ§  etc for icons. Use Lucide icons.
Every interaction needs micro-animations - hover states, transitions. Static = dead.
Use 2-3x more spacing than feels comfortable. Cramped designs look cheap.
Main agent relies on these image URLs. Missing categories = main agent will use placeholder text which is FORBIDDEN.
Prioritize using pre-existing components from src/components/ui when applicable.
Components MUST use named exports (export const ComponentName = ...).
Pages MUST use default exports (export default function PageName() {...}).
